A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: There are a few choices made deliberately to challenge the audience\, and while I find that admirable\, it seems to be a bit much for people who were hoping for another fanservice-y nostalgia-fest or to have their pet theories about who's related to who validated. I've been a Star Wars fan my whole life and as far as I'm concerned\, \"The Last Jedi\" understands more about \"Star Wars\" than \"The Force Awakens\" and \"Rogue One\" combined. It dares to be its own thing rather than be defined solely by the expectations inherited from its predecessors. It's not a perfect film\, but its ambition and skillful execution were captivating and often awe-inspiring.
